<Text:The Horsehead Amphora
3:

<Horsehead Amphora
4:
--------------------
Text: Horsehead Amphora:  The decoration was painted within reserved rectangular panels; the remaining vase of the body was painted black.
Triplets:<Horsehead Amphora
5:
--------------------
Text: Horsehead Amphora:  More than 100 such amphorae are known; they were painted by a variety of artists, including ones of mediocre quality.
Triplets:<Horsehead Amphora
6:
--------------------
<Text: Horsehead Amphora:  The amphorae appear to have had a specific meaning or purpose, remains elusive to modern scholarship.>
Triplets:<Horsehead Amphora
7:
--------------------
Text: Horsehead Amphora:
Some scholars have suggested that they were grave vases, but not a single specimen was found in a grave context.
Triplets:<Horsehead Amphora
8:
--------------------
Text: Horsehead Amphora:  Should that interpretation be correct, the horses may be connected with Hades, or be symbols of Poseidon in an unusual role as god of the underworld.

Triplets:<Horsehead Amphora
12:
--------------------
Text: Horsehead Amphora:  According to John D. Beazley, the vases were part of the Athenian vase painters' repertoire for less than half a century.
Triplets:<John D. Beazley
